result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Possession of a Controlled Substance on or near Certain Places

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Htoo Pla Soe

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on November 7, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

4:10 PM Defendant Htoo Pla Soe in court in custody.  Agency State Public Defender appeared by video. ThaBlay Wah, Karen Intepreter Sworn.  Interpreter made contact with defendant.  Mr. Soe represented today by Attorney Patek of SPD.  Mr. Soe is in custody as he was in court on 9/2 and was to appear on 9/6 and he did not appear.  The court ordered a warrant and Mr. Soe was arrested pursuant to that warrant.  The District Attorney has sent a letter to the court requesting a cash bond of $1000.00.  The Court asks Mr. Patek of his position of bond.  Defense requests a $5000 signature bond for the reasons as follows:  The defendant resides in the area; qualifies for PD representation and would be unable to post the high cash bond requested by the State.  The defense note the language barrier to some extent has affected the defendant's communication.  On 9/2 Mr. Soe appeared in court with appropriate interpreter and stated he understood what was going on.  He failed to appear on 9/6 and failed to provide any reason for his FTA.  Given the felony involved, $1000 cash bond is ordered.  Position regarding PH?  Mr. Patek asks to schedule PH.   All parties to appear in person in Durand in the courtroom.  Mr. Soe asks about his court date on 11/23.  Court will address that on 11/7.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on November 7, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: 1:41 PM Defendant Htoo Pla Soe not in court.  Attorney Jon D. Seifert appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin. Interpreter Karen Naw appeared by video.  Mr. Soe fails to appear.  Warrant requested by the State and authorized by the Court.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

No possession or consumption of controlled substances without a prescription; 
No operation of MV without a valid drivers license or insurance.

8:04 AM Defendant Htoo Pla Soe appeared by video from the Pepin County Jail with Attorney Ryan Glenn Kohler of PD Office by video.  Attorney Jon D. Seifert, DA for Pepin Co. appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin. Karen Interpreter Karen Naw appeared by video means.  Interpreter makes contact with defendant. Defendant understands interpreter.  Court advises defendant of charges in criminal complaint/max. penalties and because the offense occurred within 1000 feet of the Pepin County Jail, the Court shall impose 100 hours of community service work for a public agency or a nonprofit charitable organization. Court advises defendant of his constitutional rights.  Mr. Seifert addresses bond.  Mr. Soe is a resident of MN and has limited contact with Pepin Co., also has a limited criminal history and record shows no incidents of FTA for court appearances, therefore the State requests a signature bond of $1000.00.  Conditions:  no possession or consumption of controlled substances; no operation of MV w/o valid license.  Mr. Kohler has no objection to the State's request for bond.  Court sets $1000 signature bond with conditions:  No possession or consumption of controlled substances without a prescription; No operation of MV without a valid drivers license or insurance.   Defendant has a question regarding getting things from his car.  Court, if it is not seized for evidence.  If they will not release your car, contact Mr. Kohler with the WI SPD and you can get that phone # from the Pepin Co. Clerk of Court.  State has information for the Court.  Law enforcement has not impounded Mr. Soe's vehicle for evidentiary purpose, however, it was towed from the scene and he will have to pay the tow bill to release it.  His record shows he has a pending matter in MN that resulted in the administrative suspension of his operating privileges.  Court repeats the bond conditions to Mr. Soe:  Do not drive without a valid driver's license and do not drive without insurance.  If you get caught driving without a D/L or insurance that could be a new crime.  Defendant has no questions.  Next hearing Mr. Soe may appear by zoom if no objection by his attorney.  Mr. Kohler has no objection to zoom.  Defendant confirms his address on file.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

12:45 PM Defendant Htoo Pla Soe appeared by zoom technology by video from the Pepin Co. Jail.  Attorney Jon D. Seifert appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin. Thai Interpreter: Pim Pimpa Lorenzetti  appeared by video.  Defendant informs he does not speak Thai.  Interpreter unable to speak Thai.  Defendant speaks "Karen".  Off the record.  On the record.  At hearing will be held at 8:00 a.m. tomorrow when have an interpreter available.  Hearing adjourned.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 08:00 am.
Bail/bond hearing on September 2, 2022 at 08:00 am.
